results.title: What's the difference!
results.creator_credit: Free Kindergarten Union Multicultural Resource Centre, Maude Media, Priscilla M. Clarke and Sally Abbott-Smith
results.brief_description: Examines the role of multicultural education in early childhood development programs. Explains that multicultural education is nesessary for all children and that it should be an overall agenda, incorporated into all aspects of early childhood development education.

results.title: What's so funny?
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Steve Westh and Tony Wright
results.brief_description: Humour based on ‘ethnic’ stereotypes is problematic. The situation is confounded/complicated when delivered from someone within that ethnic group. This documentary looks at Australia’s most prominent (some say only), Vietnamese stand-up comic - Hung Le. Hung talks of his childhood in Vietnam, the move to Australia, the experiences of his family as migrants, his passion for the Carlton football club, and how he came into comedy. It explores the “Wogs out of work” phenomenon (of which Hung was involved), and includes interviews with other ‘ethnic’ comedians Vince Sorrenti, Anthony Mir and Peter Saleh, amongst others. Features excerpts of successful and not so successful stand-up routines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Film Commission, Steve Westh and Tony Wright

results.title: What's on Your Mind
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
Roughly contemporaneous with Hitchcock’s Spellbound, this NFB informational film is a survey of what was then the cutting edge of progressive psychiatry. Reflecting the new enthusiasm for pop-Freudianism in a North America seeking respite for it’s traumatised World War II veterans. Although punctuated by some lighter moments, the melodramatic music scoring reflects the film’s emotional tone. Although prone to many of the social prejudices of its day (witness gender politics), this film also provides an illuminating account of pioneering forms of psychodrama and child psychiatry.

results.title: What's new in solid waste management
results.brief_description: Describes a number of research and demonstration projects contributing to solid waste management technology in the United States. It is intended to provide useful data for the comparative analysis of these emerging new systems without the necessity of making expensive field trips. Though semi-technical and specifically intended for public officials who authorize and fund solid waste collections and disposal operations, the film is also understandable to non-technicians.

results.title: What's mad to you? Part 2. New approaches
results.creator_credit: SBS-TV, Barbara A. Chobocky and Margaret Smith
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A group of psychiatrists and counsellors who offer alternative kinds of psychiatric help talk about their methods. They all stress that the need for change has to come from the patients themselves and that any change is likely to be small and not likely to happen quickly. Some of their patients also talk about their treatment and we are shown brief glimpses of sessions between therapist and patient.
results.title_for_label: What’s mad to you? Part 2. New approaches

results.title: What's mad to you? Part 1: Glimpses from psychiatrists
results.creator_credit: SBS-TV, Barbara A. Chobocky and Margaret Smith
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
The first in a two-part series, this program looks at the stigma associated with mental illness, particularly in relation to migrants who have different value systems. A number of psychologists and psychiatrists from a wide variety of ethnic backgrounds talk about the problems as they see it. The patient’s point of view is also presented by a small group who talk about how they overcame their resistance to seeking psychiatric help.
results.title_for_label: What’s mad to you? Part 1: Glimpses from psychiatrists
results.creator_credit_for_label: SBS-TV, Barbara A. Chobocky and Margaret Smith

results.title: What's it all about, Harry?
results.brief_description: Harry and young Greg go shopping. As they shop Greg asks Harry how many bells does he give for help advice and service at each business. Harry is a telephone technician and he explains the problems dealing with various customers.
results.description: Harry and young Greg go shopping. As they shop Greg asks Harry how many bells does he give for help advice and service at each business. Harry is a telephone technician and he explains the problems dealing with various customers.

results.title: What's it all about
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Malcolm Smith and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Claims that we must learn to accept and adapt to social change.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation, Malcolm Smith and Brian Bergin
